topic_or_construct: Decision execution through the motor system
justification: “Another strand of research, focused on hand … tracking, examines how decisions are executed through the motor system.”

topic_or_construct: Decision execution through the motor system
justification: The same sentence also references “mouse tracking” as the method used to study how decisions are executed via the motor system.
“The dynamics of the response, as expressed in recorded mouse cursor trajectories, can then reveal … the degree of competition between the two options during choice.”
The article lists “latency measures (initiation … times)” indicating initiation time is used to capture decision latency.
The same list includes “response times” as another latency measure of the speed of decision making.
Consistency measures are said to include “changes in the x-direction (‘x-flips’)”, tying x-flips to decision consistency.
The same sentence cites “sample entropy” alongside x-flips as a measure of consistency in decision trajectories.
Trajectory curvature measures are described as “maximum deviation of the trajectory from an ideal, straight-line trajectory,” linking maximum deviation to curvature.
The list of curvature measures also includes “area under the curve of difference between actual and ideal trajectories,” establishing this metric as a curvature measure.
